name: Water Resources Development Act
objective: Through this assistance listing, the commissioner may enter into grants, cooperative agreements or other agreements with irrigation districts and States to cost share up to 50% of planning, designing, and constructing improvements that will conserve water, increase water use efficiency, or enhance water management through automation at existing water supply projects.

results.description: This is a new program and projects have not been funded yet.

authorizations.text: Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2005, Title II, 206. Pub. L. 108, 447.
Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, 40907. Pub. L. 117, 58.
